title: Zerubbabel
summary: According to the biblical narrative, Zerubbabel[lower-alpha 1] was a governor of the Achaemenid Empire's province Yehud Medinata[1] and the grandson of Jeconiah,[2] penultimate king of Judah. Zerubbabel led the first group of Jews, numbering 42,360, who returned from the Babylonian captivity in the first year of Cyrus the Great, the king of the Achaemenid Empire.[3] The date is generally thought to have been between 538 and 520 BC.[4] Zerubbabel also laid the foundation of the Second Temple in Jerusalem soon after.
